intro: Rubus firmosus, commonly known as the firmosus blackberry, is a species of bramble native to the eastern United States. It is characterized by its thorny stems and compound leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, aggregate fruits that are typically dark purple to black in color. It thrives in moist, wooded areas and is often found in the understory of forests. Botanically, it belongs to the Rosaceae family, sharing features with other members of the Rubus genus.
